column4: Icahn urges Navistar to offer board seats to shareholders
column5: NEW YORK Billionaire investor Carl Icahn slammed Navistar International Corp  for naming a new chief executive without consulting large shareholders  and urged the company to offer four board seats to shareholders immediately.

column4: Nikkei ends flat  exporters offset gains in China-linked shares
column5: * Exporters under pressure as yen rises on QE expectations     * Komatsu  HCM extend gains on China infrastructure spending plans     * Tech firms hurt by Intel's disappointing earnings      By Sophie Knight     TOKYO  Sept 10 Japan's Nikkei average closed flat on Monday  with losses from exporters hurt by a strong yen cancelling out gains for China-related firms boosted by the country's infrastructure drive. column4: AIG shares slip on plans for large U.S. Treasury sale
column5: American International Group  shares fell 2 percent on Monday as investors braced for the Treasury Department to unload at least $18 billion worth of stock in what could be the largest follow-on offering in the history of the U.S. stock market. | Video

column4: UPDATE 5-U.S. Treasury launches $18 billion AIG stock offering
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 The U.S. Treasury Department said it will sell most of its stake in insurer American International Group Inc  making the government a minority investor for the first time since it rescued the company in the depths of the financial crisis four years ago.

column4: BHP  Xstrata attack coal costs in Australia; jobs to go
column5: MELBOURNE Top global miners BHP Billiton and Xstrata Plc are cutting high-cost coal production in Australia as they battle weak prices  rising costs and a strong Australian dollar  adding to worries that Australia's mining boom is fading.

column4: UPDATE 2-BHP  Xstrata attack coal costs in Australia; jobs to go
column5: * BHP shuts loss-making Gregory mine  seeks more cost cuts

column4: BHP shuts Australian coal mine due to weak prices  high costs
column5: SYDNEY  Sept 10 BHP Billiton  the world's biggest miner  said on Monday it would cease production at its Gregory open cut coal mine in the state of Queensland from Oct. 10 due to weak coal prices  high costs and a strong Australian dollar.

column4: JPMorgan  Citi rethink executive compensation: WSJ
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is considering smaller bonuses for CEO James Dimon and other executives while Citigroup Inc  is also rethinking executive pay structure  both eager to placate investors after management miscues this year  the Wall Street Journal reported.

column4: Insight: GM's Volt: The ugly math of low sales  high costs
column5: General Motors Co sold a record number of Chevrolet Volt sedans in August — but that probably isn't a good thing for the automaker's bottom line.

column4: Factbox: Estimating costs of making General Motors' Volt
column5: It costs General Motors Co an estimated $75 000 to $88 000 per car to build the Chevrolet Volt plug-in hybrid  based on current sales and production volume  according to auto industry consultants who spoke with Reuters.

column4: Lonmin strikers march as South Africa mine unrest spreads
column5: MARIKANA  South Africa Around 10 000 striking South African platinum miners marched from one Lonmin mine shaft to another on Monday  threatening to kill strike breakers  as another illegal stoppage hit Gold Fields  the world's fourth biggest gold miner. | Video

column4: UPDATE 3-Lonmin strikers march as S.Africa mine unrest spreads
column5: MARIKANA  South Africa  Sept 10 Around 10 000 striking South African platinum miners marched from one Lonmin  mine shaft to another on Monday  threatening to kill strike breakers  as another illegal stoppage hit Gold Fields   the world's fourth biggest gold miner.

column4: BRIEF-Gold Fields says 15 000 workers strike at South African mine
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Sept 10 Gold Fields Ltd :  * Says employees of the west section of the KDC gold mine on illegal strike  * Says about 15 000 employees participating in the strike  * Says all production at KDC west has been suspended as result of strike

column4: CVC  Goldman eye $3.8 billion debt-for-equity swap for Australia's Nine: sources
column5: MELBOURNE Goldman Sachs and private equity firm CVC Capital Partners Ltd have proposed a debt-for-equity swap for CVC's Australian television network Nine  two sources said on Monday  a deal that would wipe out CVC's equity and pass control to its lenders.

column4: Marathon Detroit refinery said to have released unknown chemical: NRC
column5: Marathon Petroleum Corp's 106 000 barrel-per-day refinery in Detroit  Michigan is reported to have released an unknown chemical into the atmosphere on Saturday at 0700 hours local time  according to an unidentified caller cited in a filing with national pollution regulators.

column4: Sasol sees better year ahead after profit jumps
column5: JOHANNESBURG South African petrochemicals group Sasol  posted a 25 percent rise in full-year earnings on Monday  boosted by higher crude oil prices and a weaker rand  and said it expected better operational performance in the current year.

column4: BRIEF-Sasol FY headline EPS up 25 pct to 42.28 rand
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Sept 10 Sasol Ltd :  * Says headline earnings per share up by 25% to R42 28  * Says total dividend up by 35% to R17 50 per share  * Says operating profit up by 23% to R36 8 billion  * Says anticipate that Sasol synfuels production volumes will improve to

column4: Oil driller Seadrill plans $1 bln bond issue
column5: OSLO  Sept 10 Oslo-listed oil driller Seadrill  intends to issue $1.0 billion in unsecured notes due 2017 in a private offering  the firm said.

column4: TEXT-Fitch Affirms S. Korea's SK Telecom at 'A-'; Outlook Stable
column5: SEOUL/SYDNEY/SINGAPORE  September 10 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Korea-based SK Telecom Co.  Ltd's (SKT) Long-Term Foreign- and Local-Currency Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) at 'A-' with Stable Outlook. The agency has also affirmed SKT's senior unsecured rating at 'A-'.

column4: TSMC says Aug sales up 32 pct on year
column5: TAIPEI  Sept 10 TSMC  the world's biggest contract chip maker  said on Monday that sales in August rose 32 percent from a year earlier.

column4: Blackstone names adviser to chase Australia deals
column5: MELBOURNE Global private equity fund Blackstone Group LP  said it has appointed James Carnegie  a former partner at top-tier Australian private equity firm Archer Capital  as a senior adviser as the firm chases buyout opportunities in Australia.

column4: RPT-Transocean to sell 38 shallow-water drilling rigs
column5: Sept 10 Transocean Ltd   owner of the world's largest offshore drilling fleet  said it will sell 38 shallow-water drilling rigs to Shelf Drilling International Holdings Ltd for about $855 million in cash.
